definition: to drag/to tow/to trail/to hang down/to mop (the floor)/to delay/to drag on
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
variant of 它[ta1]
in arrears/behind in payments/to default on one's debts
to delay/to put off/to procrastinate
to encumber/to be a burden on/to implicate
tractor/CL:臺|台[tai2]
slippers/sandals/flip-flops/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to tow/towed vehicle/towing vehicle
(dialect) to date sb
dilatory/sluggish/muddled/roundabout
mop
to drag along/to haul/(fig.) to procrastinate/shilly-shallying/sluggish/(computing) drag and drop/(loanword) tola, unit of weight, approx. 11.664 grams
to drag/to tow/(computing) to drag (mouse operation)
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to pull/to drag/to haul
tugboat
tugboat/boat towed by a tugboat/to tow a boat

sentences.english: They towed the van to the church parking lot for safekeeping.
sentences.chinese: 他們把箱型車拖到教會的停車場保管。

sentences.english: The escaped prisoner was dragged from his hiding-place.
sentences.chinese: 那逃犯從他隱藏的地方被拖了出來。

sentences.english: Drag and drop the rest of the elements to their related table column.
sentences.chinese: 將剩下的元素拖放到相關的表列上。
懷疑永遠是拖着沉重的步伐。

sentences.english: The taxi that towed us to the nearest town was just as bad.
sentences.chinese: 那輛拖着我們到最近市鎮的的士同樣破破爛爛。

sentences.english: With one last heave, the net was hauled in.
sentences.chinese: 隨着最後的一下猛拉，網被拖了上來。

sentences.english: The broken-down car was taken in tow by a lorry.
sentences.chinese: 那輛壞了的車由一輛貨車拖着。

sentences.english: We should diminish the inflammation on time if we get internal heat.
sentences.chinese: 身體有了急火要及時消炎，拖不得。

sentences.english: They had been told only one month but drag the half-year cycle drawback.
sentences.chinese: 當初被告知只需一個月的退稅週期卻拖了近半年。

sentences.english: I said at a meeting held in Dazhai that a failing agriculture would be an obstruction to industrial development.
sentences.chinese: 我在大寨會上說，農業搞不好就要拖工業的後腿。

sentences.english: You dragged me all the way out here to watch a war movie?
sentences.chinese: 你大老遠拖我到這裏來看戰爭片？

sentences.english: These issues have lain around unresolved for far too long.
sentences.chinese: 這些問題沒有被解決拖得時間太久啦。

sentences.english: He had removed his shoes and donned a pair of blue, faded carpet-slippers.
sentences.chinese: 沒有穿鞋，腳上蹬着一雙褪色的蘭色地毯拖。

sentences.english: Satan pocketed a bottle and shuffled toward the car.
sentences.chinese: 撒旦將一隻瓶子揣進口袋，拖着雙腳走向車子。

sentences.english: The horse took fright and ran away with the carriage.
sentences.chinese: 馬受了驚，拖着馬車狂奔起來。

sentences.english: Click and drag from the start to end-point that you wish to measure.
sentences.chinese: 點擊後從起點拖到終點來進行測量。

definition: to drag along/to haul/(fig.) to procrastinate/shilly-shallying/sluggish/(computing) drag and drop/(loanword) tola, unit of weight, approx. 11.664 grams

to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to tarry/to delay/to stop over
to recline/to lie down
to procrastinate
to throw/to throw away
variant of 扯[che3]/to pull/to tear
to toss from side to side (e.g. sleeplessly)/to repeat sth over and over again/to torment sb/to play crazy/to squander (time, money)
to throw/to fling/to swing/to leave behind/to throw off/to dump (sb)
to delay/to hold up/to waste time/to interfere with
to overtake
to expel/to oust/(dialect) to chase after/to try to catch up with
soon/in a moment/to look on as sth happens
from now on/in the future/time to come
